moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. h4 g4 5: Where every game in the mini began. The position leads to interesting play.
moves.8... Bxe5 9. Re1: To avoid losing the pinned B, Black must move his King on this move to break the pin.
moves.9... Nbd7 10. d4: Since he didn't, the Bishop now falls.
moves.10... O-O 11. dxe5: Now that I've equalized the material, I must quickly develop my Q-side.
moves.11... Nh5 12. Nc3: The KRP can't be saved, so I focus on development.
moves.12... Qxh4 13. e6: Aiming to drive his QN and seal in his QB.
moves.13... g3 14. Qf3: Developing another piece and preventing his Pawns from swarming in on my King.
moves.14... Qh2+ 15. Kf1: Forced, but helpful. Now I will seek shelter in the open center of the board.
moves.15... Ne5 16. Rxe5: I gladly take the free Knight.
moves.16... Nf6 17. Ke2: Now once I activate my QB, my King will be secure and I can focus on attacking and simplifying.
moves.17... Kh8 18. Bxf4: Black's Queen, stuck in the corner, will be forced off the board in a moment.
moves.18... a6 19. Qxg3: The Queens, and Black's attacking chances, vanish.
moves.19... Qxg3 20. Bxg3: Now my positional and material advantages should be enough to win.
moves.20... fxe6 21. dxe6: The advanced passed Pawn brings with it a new set of threats.
moves.21... Ng4 22. Rg5: Forcing the Knight away from the defense of B-K5 ch.
moves.22... Nf6 23. Be5: Now B-K5 is a pinning mate threat. The Rook is tethered to the KB file.
moves.23... b5 24. e7: Mate, or catastrophic material loss, is now forced. Black resigns.
